ai_flow.api package¶

Submodules¶

ai_flow.api.ai_flow_context module¶

ai_flow.api.ai_flow_context.init_ai_flow_context()[source]¶

When defining the ai flow program, you need to call this function to initialize the project and workflow environment information. This function has three functions: 1. Init project context 2. Init project configuration 3. Init workflow configuration.

ai_flow.api.ops module¶

ai_flow.api.ops.action_on_dataset_event(job_name: str, dataset_name: str, action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction = TaskAction.START, namespace: str = 'default') → None[source]¶

Add dataset control dependency. It means src channel will start when and only the an new dataset of the specific dataset is updated in notification service. :param namespace: the namespace of the dataset :param job_name: The job name :param dataset_name: Name of the dataset, refers to a specific dataset. :param action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction :return: None.

ai_flow.api.ops.action_on_event(job_name: str, event_key: str, event_value: str, event_type: str = 'UNDEFINED', sender: Optional[str] = None, namespace: str = 'default', condition_type: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ConditionType = ConditionType.NECESSARY, action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction = TaskAction.START, life: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventLife = EventLife.ONCE, value_condition: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ValueCondition = ValueCondition.EQUALS)[source]¶

Add user defined control logic. :param job_name: The job name identify the job. :param namespace: The namespace of the event, which value uses the project name. :param event_key: The key of the event. :param event_value: The value of the event. :param event_type: The type of the event. :param sender: The event sender identity,which value uses the name of the job. If sender is None, the sender will be dependency. :param condition_type: The condition type. Sufficient or Necessary. :param action: The action act on the src channel. Start or Restart. :param life: The life of the event. Once or Repeated. :param value_condition: The event value condition. Equal or Update. Equal means the src channel will start or

restart only when in the condition that the notification service updates a value which equals to the event value under the specific event key, while update means src channel will start or restart when in the the condition that the notification service has a update operation on the event key which event value belongs.

:return:None.

ai_flow.api.ops.action_on_job_status(job_name: str, upstream_job_name: str, upstream_job_status: ai_flow.workflow.status.Status = Status.FINISHED, action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction = TaskAction.START, condition_type: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ConditionType = ConditionType.SUFFICIENT)[source]¶

Trigger job by upstream job status changed. :param job_name: The job name :param upstream_job_name: The upstream job name :param upstream_job_status: The upstream job status, type: ai_flow.workflow.status.Status :param action: The ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction type. :param condition: The condition. Sufficient or Necessary. :return:

ai_flow.api.ops.action_on_model_version_event(job_name: str, model_name: str, model_version_event_type: str, namespace: str = 'default', action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction = TaskAction.RESTART) → None[source]¶

Add model version control dependency. It means src channel will start when and only a new model version of the specific model is updated in notification service.

Parameters

  • action – ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.TaskAction

  • namespace – the namespace of the event.

  • model_version_event_type – one of ai_flow.model_center.entity.model_version_stage.ModelVersionEventType

  • job_name – The job name

  • model_name – Name of the model, refers to a specific model.

Returns

None.

ai_flow.api.ops.dataset_validate(input: ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, dataset_validation_processor, name: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]¶

Dataset Validator Operator. Identifies anomalies in training and serving data in this operator.

Parameters

  • input – Channel. It contains the dataset data used in evaluation.

  • dataset_validation_processor – The user defined function in dataset validate operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • name – Name of the dataset validate operator.

Returns

NoneChannel.

ai_flow.api.ops.evaluate(input: Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]], model_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int], evaluation_processor, output_num=0, name: Optional[str] = None) → Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

Evaluate Operator. Do evaluate job with the specific model version.

Parameters

  • input – List of Channel. It contains the dataset data used in prediction.

  • model_info – Information about the model which is in prediction. Its type can be ModelMeta of ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • evaluation_processor – The user defined function in evaluate operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 0.

  • name – Name of the predict operator.

Returns

NoneChannel.

ai_flow.api.ops.model_validate(input: Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]], model_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int], model_validation_processor, model_version_info: Optional[Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta, str]] = None, base_model_version_info: Optional[Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta, str]] = None, output_num=0, name: Optional[str] = None) → Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

Model Validator Operator. Compare the performance of two different versions of the same model and choose the better model version to make it ready to be in the stage of deployment.

Parameters

  • input – List of Channel. It contains the dataset data used in model validation.

  • model_info – Information about the model which is in model validation. Its type can be ModelMeta of ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • model_validation_processor – The user defined function in model validate operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • model_version_info – Information about the model version which is in model validation. Its type can be ModelVersionMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta or Text. The model_version_info means version in the metadata service when its type is Text. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by version.

  • base_model_version_info – Information about the model version which is in model validation. Its type can be ModelVersionMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta or Text. The model_version_info means version in the metadata service when its type is Text. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by version.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 0.

  • name – Name of the model validate operator.

Returns

Channel.

ai_flow.api.ops.predict(input: Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]], model_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int], prediction_processor, model_version_info: Optional[Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta, str]] = None, output_num=1, name: Optional[str] = None) → Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

Predictor Operator. Do prediction job with the specific model version.

Parameters

  • input – List of Channel. It contains the dataset data used in prediction.

  • model_info – Information about the model which is in prediction. Its type can be ModelMeta of ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • prediction_processor – The user defined function in predict operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • model_version_info – Information about the model version which is in prediction. Its type can be ModelVersionMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta or Text. The model_version_info means version in the metadata service when its type is Text. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by version.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 1.

  • name – Name of the predict operator.

Returns

Channel or Tuple[Channel].

ai_flow.api.ops.push_model(model_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int], pushing_model_processor, model_version_info: Optional[Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta, str]] = None, name: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]¶

Pusher operator. The pusher operator is used to push a validated model which is better than previous one to a deployment target.

Parameters

  • model_info – Information about the model which is in pusher. Its type can be ModelMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • pushing_model_processor – The user defined function in pusher operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • model_version_info – Information about the model version which is in push. Its type can be ModelVersionMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelVersionMeta or Text. The model_version_info means version in the metadata service when its type is Text. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by version.

  • name – Name of the push operator.

Returns

None.

ai_flow.api.ops.read_dataset(dataset_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta, str, int], read_dataset_processor=None, name: Optional[str] = None) → ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel[source]¶

Read dataset from the dataset operator. It can read dataset from external system.

Parameters

  • dataset_info – Information about the dataset which will be read. Its type can be DatasetMeta of ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta or Text or int. The dataset_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the dataset from metadata service by name or id.

  • read_dataset_processor – The python user defined function in read dataset operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • name – Name of the read_dataset operator.

Returns

ai_flow.graph.channel.

ai_flow.api.ops.train(input: Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]], training_processor, model_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int], base_model_info: Optional[Union[ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta, str, int]] = None, output_num=0, name: Optional[str] = None) → Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

Trainer operator. Train model with the inputs or continually re-training the base model.

Parameters

  • input – List of Channel. It contains multiple channels from the operators which generate data.

  • training_processor – The user defined function in train operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • model_info – Information about the output model which is under training. Its type can be ModelMeta of ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The output_model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • base_model_info – Information about the base model which will be trained. Its type can be ModelMeta of py:class:ai_flow.meta.model_meta.ModelMeta or Text or int. The base_model_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the model meta from metadata service by name or id.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 0.

  • name – Name of the train operator.

Returns

Channel, Tuple[Channel].

ai_flow.api.ops.transform(input: Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]], transform_processor, output_num=1, name: Optional[str] = None) → Union[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

Transformer operator. Transform the dataset so that the original dataset can be used for trainer or other operators after feature engineering, data cleaning or some other data transformation.

Parameters

  • input – List of input data. It contains multiple channels from the operators which generate data.

  • transform_processor – The user defined function in transform operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 1.

  • name – Name of the transform operator.

Returns

Channel or Tuple[Channel]. It returns Channel When the output_num is 1 and returns Tuple[Channel] when the output_num is bigger than 1, and the len(Tuple(Channel)) is output_num.

ai_flow.api.ops.user_define_operation(processor=None, input: Union[None, ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]] = None, output_num=1, name: Optional[str] = None, operation_type: str = 'user_define_operation', **kwargs) → Union[None, ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, Tuple[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]][source]¶

User defined operator.

Parameters

  • operation_type – The type of the operation.

  • processor – The user defined function in operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • input – It contains multiple channels from the operators which generate data.

  • output_num – The output number of the operator. The default value is 1.

  • name – Name of this operator.

  • kwargs –

Returns

None or Channel or Tuple[Channel].

ai_flow.api.ops.write_dataset(input: ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, dataset_info: Union[ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta, str, int], write_dataset_processor=None, name: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]¶

Write dataset to dataset operator. It can write dataset to external system.

Parameters

  • input – Channel from the specific operator which generates data.

  • dataset_info – Information about the dataset which will be read. Its type can be DataSetMeta of ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta or Text or int. The dataset_info means name in the metadata service when its type is Text and it means id when its type is int. The ai flow will get the dataset from metadata service by name or id.

  • write_dataset_processor – The python user defined function in write dataset operator. User can write their own logic here.

  • name – Name of the read_dataset operator.

Returns

None.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation module¶

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.delete_workflow(workflow_name: Optional[str] = None) → ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.WorkflowInfo[source]¶

Delete the ai flow workflow from the scheduler. :param workflow_name: The name of the workflow(ai_flow.workflow.workflow.Workflow). :return: The information of the workflow.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.get_job_execution(job_name: str, execution_id: str) → ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.JobExecutionInfo[source]¶

Get job information by job name. :param job_name: The job name which task defined in workflow. :param execution_id: The workflow identity of one execution. :return: Information about one execution of the job.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.get_workflow(workflow_name: Optional[str] = None) → Optional[ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.WorkflowInfo][source]¶

Get the workflow information. :param workflow_name: The name of the workflow(ai_flow.workflow.workflow.Workflow). :return: The information of the workflow.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.get_workflow_execution(execution_id: str) → ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.WorkflowExecutionInfo[source]¶

Get the WorkflowExecutionInfo from scheduler. :param execution_id: The workflow identity of one execution. :return: The information of a execution of workflow.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.list_job_executions(execution_id: str) → List[ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.JobExecutionInfo][source]¶

List the jobs of the workflow execution. :param execution_id: The workflow identity of one execution. :return: Information about executions of the job in the workflow.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.list_workflow_executions(workflow_name: str) → List[ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.WorkflowExecutionInfo][source]¶
Parameters

workflow_name – The name of the workflow(ai_flow.workflow.workflow.Workflow).

Returns

All workflow executions of the workflow.

ai_flow.api.workflow_operation.list_workflows(page_size: int, offset: int) → Optional[List[ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.WorkflowInfo]][source]¶

List the ai flow workflows. :param page_size: Limitation of listed workflows. :param offset: Offset of listed workflows. :return: The information of the workflow list.
